2.title: Laughs at FunHouse Lounge

episode of.title: Have You Heard? with Byron Beck (TV Series 2011– )

2.plot: Byron Beck visits the FunHouse Lounge, a brand new bar and entertainment venue operated by Trenton Shine and Andy Barrett. They are treated to a performance by The Unscriptables, Portland's very own unscripted comedy theater group, and the uber-talented singer Jordan Harris. And since the venue doesn't serve mixed drinks - only beer and shots! - we treated Executive Producer Trudi Nagel Morrison to a shot of Tequila!

3.title: Coffee and Architecture

episode of.title: Have You Heard? with Byron Beck (TV Series 2011– )

3.plot: Byron Beck and co-host Nancy Rommelmann pay a visit to the newly restored Schoolhouse Building on NW Nicolai Street, now home to Schoolhouse Electric and Ristretto Roasters. Join them as they chat with Schoolhouse owner Brian Faherty, Accelerated Development's Keith Shrader, and enjoy some pour-over coffee with Ristretto owner Din Johnson.

4.title: NW Film Center

episode of.title: Have You Heard? with Byron Beck (TV Series 2011– )

4.plot: Byron Beck and guest co-host actor Ryan McCluskey visit the NW Film Center and chat with Jessica Lyness about her short film "The Lost Van Gogh" and share a few cocktails with Brett Soulek of My Bartender.

7.title: Oregon Ballet Theater

episode of.title: Have You Heard? with Byron Beck (TV Series 2011– )

7.plot: Byron Beck pays a visit to the Oregon Ballet Theater to chat with Executive Director Diane Syrcle about their new season and upcoming show "Giselle". Byron channels his inner ballerina and dons a tutu and joins a class before being kicked out by Ballet Master Lisa Kipp. And no episode would be complete without a cocktail, and Byron is joined by Chris Joseph, owner of Morrison Hotel Bar, who makes up a delicious Cilantro Martini.

8.title: Oddballs, Meats and Cocktails

episode of.title: Have You Heard? with Byron Beck (TV Series 2011– )

8.plot: Byron Beck crashes Oddball Shoes to chat with owners Seth and Zac Longaker, purveyors of shoes for men size 14 and up. They are joined by Rosemary Robinson of Portland Garment Factory, who has teamed up with Oddball to create a line of clothing tailored to fit tall bodies. Afterwards, the boys retreat to the secret Oddball break room for some meaty treats with Eli Cairo of Olympic Provisions and an Old Fashioned cocktail courtesy of bartender Adam Robinson of Bent Brick.

9.title: The Fabulous Female Filmmakers of POWFest

episode of.title: Have You Heard? with Byron Beck (TV Series 2011– )

9.plot: Byron Beck and POWFest Executive Director Tara Johnson-Medinger present a very special female filmmaker focused edition of Have You Heard! Local filmmakers Courtenay Hameister with her short film "Stella's Flight", Shilpa Sunthankar with "The Company of Thieves", Eliza Greenwood and "Austin Unbound" - and even HYH Producer Jacqueline Gault with two films screening this year: "Dinner Party" and "Sack Lunch" - represent some of the fabulous filmmakers who will be screening at this year's POWFest. They close the show with a sparkling cocktail from Anna Landreth, owner of...

44.title: At Home with Storm LArge

episode of.title: Have You Heard? with Byron Beck (TV Series 2011– )

44.plot: Byron Beck pays a surprise visit to singing sensation Storm Large by crashing her pad with coffee in bed! They duo is then treated to a song by Storm's fiancé Michael Shapiro. And you won't want to miss Storm's reaction when she enters her kitchen and is greeted by a very special surprise guest - Mayor Sam Adams!
